column4: Hi, I'm using jaunty, and I can't use apt-get update to get any packages. I just get 404s. Looking at the site itself, it looks like jaunty no longer exists (but stuff like dapper is still there)
is there any way for me to upgrade to a newer distro? Is this even advisable for me using a lower end netbook?
preferably without downloading a new CD :|
move your /home to its own partition (if it's not already there) and get a recent live cd to re-install the entire system with.
